com.pixolus.meterreading

Class MeterReadingActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • com.pixolus.meterreading.MeterReadingActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentCallbacks, ComponentCallbacks2, KeyEvent.Callback, LayoutInflater.Factory, LayoutInflater.Factory2, View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, Window.Callback, BarcodeReadingListener, CameraListener, MeterReadingListener

    public class MeterReadingActivity
extends Activity
implements BarcodeReadingListener, MeterReadingListener
    Self-contained Activity to perform optical meter reading. This Activity is a self-contained meter reader that you can instantiate using startActivityForResult(). It will present a user interface, control the camera and invoke the actual OCR algorithm. You can pass parameters to the activity by using Intent.putExtra() and results will be passed to your Activity.onActivityResult() method.

    Possible values for the resultCode parameter in the Activity.onActivityResult(int, int, android.content.Intent) are:

    • Activity.RESULT_OK indicates that the activity was successful. In this case, you can query the meter reading results by accessing the extra for the key RESULT_EXTRA_READINGS of the intent parameter passed to the Activity.onActivityResult(int, int, android.content.Intent) callback method. (Use Intent.getParcelableArrayListExtra(String) to obtain an array of type ArrayList<MeterReadingResult>.)
    • Activity.RESULT_CANCELED indicates that the activity was cancelled by the user (typically due to tapping the back button).
    • RESULT_ERROR_NO_CAMERA_ACCESS indicates that the activity failed because the camera hardware could not be accessed.

    To use this Activity as-is, you can override the default button labels ("Cancel" and "Toggle torch") by specifying the string resources

    • meterReaderCancelButton
    • meterReaderTorchButton
    in your strings file.

    Subclassing notes:

    You will most likely want to extend this class to provide your own user interface and possibly result handling. Generally, subclasses should override onCreateOverlayView() to customize the user interface. Another candidate for overriding is the MeterReadingListener.onScanReadings(com.pixolus.meterreading.MeterReadingFragment, java.util.List<com.pixolus.meterreading.MeterReadingResult>, android.graphics.Bitmap, com.pixolus.meterreading.Metadata) method which allows to perform custom results handling and also allows access to the actual image data and metadata which are otherwise not exposed publicly by the MeterReadingActivity class. If you override onScanReadings(), you can still use returnResults(int, java.util.ArrayList) for finishing the meter reading activity and returning reading results to the calling activity.

    Internally, this activity builds upon the MeterReadingFragment, surrounding it with a full screen user interface and the Intent mechanism.

    See Also:
    MeterReadingFragment

      • RESULT_ERROR_NO_CAMERA_ACCESS

        public static final int RESULT_ERROR_NO_CAMERA_ACCESS
        Activity result: operation was canceled because the camera could not be accessed. This value may be used for the resultCode in the Activity.onActivityResult(int, int, android.content.Intent) callback.

        This value is equal to Activity.RESULT_FIRST_USER.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getMeterReadingFragment

        protected MeterReadingFragment getMeterReadingFragment()
        The MeterReadingFragment instance used by the activity.

        This function returns null before the MeterReadingFragment instance is attached to the activity. In order to perform initial setup of the MeterReadingFragment, it is suggested to override the Activity.onAttachFragment(android.app.Fragment) method and check whether the attached fragment is identical to the one returned by this method.

        Returns:
        The MeterReadingFragment instance used by the activity or null if no instance is attached to the activity yet.

      • onCameraReady

        public void onCameraReady(MeterReadingFragment meterReader)
        Called when the underlying MeterReadingFragment has established the connection to the camera.

        The default implementation sets the visibility of the torch button in the default overlay depending on whether the device has a torch or not.

        Specified by:
        onCameraReady in interface CameraListener
        Parameters:
        meterReader - The Fragment that originated the call.
        See Also:

      • onLayoutChanged

        public void onLayoutChanged(MeterReadingFragment meterReadingFragment,
                            boolean changed,
                            int left,
                            int top,
                            int right,
                            int bottom)
        This method is invoked when the layout of the camera view is changed. You can use it to adapt the layout of your view, fragment, activity, ... to the modified layout of the view. Also if you have custom overlays to this view, you should probably adapt them in this call.
        Specified by:
        onLayoutChanged in interface CameraListener
        Parameters:
        meterReadingFragment - The MeterReadingFragment that originated the call.
        changed - Did the layout change?
        left - The x coordinate of the left side of the view.
        top - The y coordinate of the top side of the view.
        right - The x coordinate of the right side of the view.
        bottom - The y coordinate of the bottom side of the view.

      • onCreateOverlayView

        protected View onCreateOverlayView()
        Can be overridden by subclasses to return an overlay for the camera preview. The overlay will be installed in a FrameLayout with layout parameters ViewGroup.LayoutParams.MATCH_PARENT for width and height.

        If you override this method and return null, the default overlay will be created and displayed. If you do not want any overlay to be displayed, return an empty view from your implementation.

        You should generally avoid invoking super's implementation from your subclass.

        This method is called from the implementation of onCreate(android.os.Bundle).

        Returns:
        A newly created view to be used as overlay view.

      • onFirstDetection

        public void onFirstDetection(MeterReadingFragment meterReadingFragment)
        Called when the underlying MeterReadingFragment has detected a meter for the first time.

        The default implementation does nothing.

        Specified by:
        onFirstDetection in interface MeterReadingListener
        Parameters:
        meterReadingFragment - The Fragment that originated the call.
        See Also:
        MeterReadingListener.onFirstDetection(MeterReadingFragment)

      • onScanReadings

        public void onScanReadings(MeterReadingFragment meterReadingFragment,
                           List<MeterReadingResult> results,
                           Bitmap image,
                           Metadata metadata)
        Called when the underlying MeterReadingFragment obtained reading results, either by successfully reading one or more counters, because a timeout occurred, or a manual capture was initiated.

        The default implementation just invokes the returnResults(int, java.util.ArrayList<com.pixolus.meterreading.MeterReadingResult>) method with an activityResult value of Activity.RESULT_OK and the obtained meter reading results.

        Specified by:
        onScanReadings in interface MeterReadingListener
        Parameters:
        meterReadingFragment - The Fragment that originated the call.
        results - A List of actual results (i.e. metering values).
        image - A Bitmap that shows the results.
        metadata - Additional information about the reading.
        See Also:
        MeterReadingListener.onScanReadings(com.pixolus.meterreading.MeterReadingFragment, java.util.List<com.pixolus.meterreading.MeterReadingResult>, android.graphics.Bitmap, com.pixolus.meterreading.Metadata)

      • onScanBarcodes

        public void onScanBarcodes(MeterReadingFragment meterReadingFragment,
                           List<BarcodeReadingResult> results,
                           Bitmap image,
                           Metadata metadata)
        This callback is invoked by a MeterReadingFragment whenever a barcode could be read.
        Specified by:
        onScanBarcodes in interface BarcodeReadingListener
        Parameters:
        meterReadingFragment - The Fragment that originated the call.
        results - The list of actual results (i.e. read barcodes).
        image - The bitmap image on which the results were scanned.
        metadata - Additional information about the reading.

      • onBackPressed

        public void onBackPressed()
        Called when the activity has detected the user's press of the back key.

        You can override this method in your subclass if you want to perform custom handling of the back button. The default implementation invokes the returnResults(int, java.util.ArrayList<com.pixolus.meterreading.MeterReadingResult>) method with a activityResult value of Activity.RESULT_CANCELED and null as meter reading results and finishes the activity.

        Overrides:
        onBackPressed in class Activity

      • returnResults

        protected void returnResults(int activityResult,
                             @Nullable @CheckForNull
                             ArrayList<MeterReadingResult> results)
        Store a result code and meter reading results in an intent that is set as the result of the receiver and finish the activity.

        You can use this method in subclasses to finish the activity and return reading results in an intent. The passed in reading results are set as extra value to a newly created Intent using the RESULT_EXTRA_READINGS key. Then, the Activity.setResult(int, android.content.Intent) method is invoked, passing the activityResult as first and the newly created intent as second parameter. Finally, the Activity.finish() method is invoked.

        In the implementation of the Activity.onActivityResult(int, int, android.content.Intent) of the calling activity, use the Intent.getParcelableArrayListExtra(String) method on the intent parameter to retrieve a value of type ArrayList<MeterReadingResult>. Note that the Intent.getParcelableArrayListExtra(String) may return null if no results are provided.

        Parameters:
        activityResult - This value is used as resultCode of the intent delivered via the Activity.onActivityResult(int, int, android.content.Intent) method.
        results - This is used as value for the RESULT_EXTRA_READINGS extra of the intent delivered via the Activity.onActivityResult(int, int, android.content.Intent) method.

      • isArchitectureSupported

        public static boolean isArchitectureSupported()
        Check whether the current hardware platform is supported by the pixometer SDK.
        Returns:
        True on supported hardware platforms, false otherwise.
